title: Deptford 'murder': Woman 'may have rotted in flat for month' after neighbours spot maggots
text:

A woman found strangled to death may have rotted in her flat for a month, shocked neighbours claim.

Police discovered the decomposed body of Zoe Orton, 46, after her next door neighbour spotted maggots outside her front door on Monday.

Murder squad police have appealed for witnesses as a hunt for her killer was launched today.

Her dad-of-two neighbour Adeni Mohamad, 54, who lives in the red brick four-storey council block of flats in Deptford, south east London, said his wife had likened the smell to a "dead animal".

"We started calling the council for three or four weeks," he said.

"The odours started coming - three or four weeks that I would be smelling it.

"I asked my wife to call them before. I think a couple of days and then she found maggots on the floor, on her doorstep.

(Image: Paul Davey/SWNS)

(Image: Paul Davey/SWNS)

"We called the council and they ran down to the police and they broke the door.

"I saw her almost two months ago.

"I didn't think she would be dead."

His wife added: "I tried to call them but they were always engaged.

"On Monday morning as I was taking my child downstairs when I looked, it was three maggots.

"I thought it was a dead animal."

(Image: Paul Davey/SWNS)

Police are investigating the death but so far there have been no arrests.

A spokesman said: ""Police were called to a flat in McMillan Street shortly after 10am on Monday October 21st, following concern for the welfare of an occupant.

"Officers attended. The body of Zoe Orton, aged 46, was found at the address. Next of kin have been informed.

"A post mortem took place on Tuesday. The cause of death given as neck compression."
description: Neighbours raised the alarm after Zoe Orton, 46, hadn't been seen for weeks and complained that a smell like a "dead animal" was coming from the apartment
